ol.li: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" Observation (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood)

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code
A coded value that indentifies the measurement, test, or examination whose result is being conveyed. The verbatim text is placed within the original text property of the CD data type. [SDTM: EGTESTCD, EGTEST]

SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] effectiveTime
The performance date of the ECG test. [SDTM: EGDTC]

SHALL contain [1..3] id
A value that is provided to ensure the uniqueness of ECG test result items. [SDTM: EGSEQ, EGREFID, EGSPID] A single identifier, the sequence number, is required.

SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] value
Captures the ECG measurement or finding. The finding may be recorded as a coded value - if the result is character based - or as a physical quantity - if the result is numeric. [SDTM: EGORRES, EGORRESU, EGSTRESC, EGSTRESN, EGSTRESU]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Allows capture of a group identifier for the ECG result.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Group Identifier (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.63)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Indicates a category the ECG test result is assigned to.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship Contains exactly one [1..1] ecgTestResultCategory with data type ecg Test Result Category

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Indicates a subcategory the ECG test result is assigned to.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship Contains exactly one [1..1] ecgTestResultSubCategory with data type ecg Test Result Sub Category

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Records the body position of the subject at the time of creating the ECG result.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] position with data type position

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] statusCode
Used to indicate whether the activity - performance of the ECG - did occur. Use statusCode "Completed" if the use occurred. [SDTM: EGSTAT]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Provides a reason for not capturing information for the ECG test result.
Contains exactly one [1..1] Non Performance Reason (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.64)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] methodCode
Capture the method of the ECG test. [SDTM: EGMETHOD]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text
The reference property of the ED data type is used to capture the file name and path for the external ECG waveform file. [SDTM: EGXFN]

SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
captures the location - on the subject's body - of a lead used for collecting ECG information.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain zero or one [0..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] ecgLeadLocation with data type ecg Lead Location

SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Used to indicate whether or not a result is considered a baseline value for the study.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Baseline Indicator (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.56)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Used to indicate whether or not a data value has derived frrom the results of other tests or inquiries.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Derived Data Indicator (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.60)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Used to record the study day associated with an activity taking place during a single day.
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Event Study Day (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.62)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Orients the performance of the ECG test with respect to a study defined timepoint.
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Timing Reference (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.74)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] study Test Performer
Used to record the organization performing the test.
Contains exactly one [1..1] Study Test Performer (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.73)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] study Finding Evaluator
Used to record the role played by the person providing the value of a subjective finding.
Contains exactly one [1..1] Study Finding Evaluator (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.72)

SHALL satisfy: Use the PQR type. Capture the numeric result in standard units as value and unit, capture the numeric result in the orginal units as a translation. Note, this is only necessary if the original result does not use the standard units.

SHALL satisfy: Use the CE type. Capture the character result in standard units as code and code system, capture the character result in the orginal units as a translation. Note, this is only necessary if the original result does not use the standard format.
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" Observation (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood)

SHALL contain [1..3] id
A value that is provided to ensure the uniqueness of ECG test result items. [SDTM: EGSEQ, EGREFID, EGSPID] A single identifier, the sequence number, is required.

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code
A coded value that indentifies the measurement, test, or examination whose result is being conveyed. The verbatim text is placed within the original text property of the CD data type. [SDTM: EGTESTCD, EGTEST]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text
The reference property of the ED data type is used to capture the file name and path for the external ECG waveform file. [SDTM: EGXFN]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] statusCode
Used to indicate whether the activity - performance of the ECG - did occur. Use statusCode "Completed" if the use occurred. [SDTM: EGSTAT]

SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] effectiveTime
The performance date of the ECG test. [SDTM: EGDTC]

SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] value
Captures the ECG measurement or finding. The finding may be recorded as a coded value - if the result is character based - or as a physical quantity - if the result is numeric. [SDTM: EGORRES, EGORRESU, EGSTRESC, EGSTRESN, EGSTRESU]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] methodCode
Capture the method of the ECG test. [SDTM: EGMETHOD]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Group Identifier (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.63)
Allows capture of a group identifier for the ECG result.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Indicates a category the ECG test result is assigned to.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship Contains exactly one [1..1] ecgTestResultCategory with data type ecg Test Result Category

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Indicates a subcategory the ECG test result is assigned to.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship Contains exactly one [1..1] ecgTestResultSubCategory with data type ecg Test Result Sub Category

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Records the body position of the subject at the time of creating the ECG result.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] position with data type position

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains exactly one [1..1] Non Performance Reason (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.64)
Provides a reason for not capturing information for the ECG test result.

SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
captures the location - on the subject's body - of a lead used for collecting ECG information.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain zero or one [0..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] ecgLeadLocation with data type ecg Lead Location

SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Baseline Indicator (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.56)
Used to indicate whether or not a result is considered a baseline value for the study.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Derived Data Indicator (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.60)
Used to indicate whether or not a data value has derived frrom the results of other tests or inquiries.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Event Study Day (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.62)
Used to record the study day associated with an activity taking place during a single day.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Timing Reference (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.74)
Orients the performance of the ECG test with respect to a study defined timepoint.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] study Test Performer
Contains exactly one [1..1] Study Test Performer (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.73)
Used to record the organization performing the test.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] study Finding Evaluator
Contains exactly one [1..1] Study Finding Evaluator (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.72)
Used to record the role played by the person providing the value of a subjective finding.

SHALL satisfy: Use the PQR type. Capture the numeric result in standard units as value and unit, capture the numeric result in the orginal units as a translation. Note, this is only necessary if the original result does not use the standard units.

SHALL satisfy: Use the CE type. Capture the character result in standard units as code and code system, capture the character result in the orginal units as a translation. Note, this is only necessary if the original result does not use the standard format.
